verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass in the month<WH2320> Nisan,<WH5212> in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king,<WH4428> that wine<WH3196> was before<WH6440> him: and I took<WH5375> up the wine,<WH3196> and gave<WH5414> it to the king.<WH4428> Now I had not been<WH1961> beforetime sad<WH7451> in his presence.<WH6440>

Why the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to me, Why<WH4069> is your countenance<WH6440> sad,<WH7451> seeing you are not sick?<WH2470> this<WH2088> is nothing<WH369> else but sorrow<WH7455> of heart.<WH3820> Then I was very<WH3966> sore<WH7235> afraid,<WH3372>

And said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> Let the king<WH4428> live<WH2421> for ever:<WH5769> why<WH4069> should not my countenance<WH6440> be sad,<WH7489> when<WH834> the city,<WH5892> the place<WH1004> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchers,<WH6913> lies waste,<WH2720> and the gates<WH8179> thereof are consumed<WH398> with fire?<WH784>
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to me, For what<WH4100> do you make request?<WH1245> So I prayed<WH6419> to the God<WH430> of heaven.<WH8064>

And I said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> If<WH518> it please<WH2895> the king,<WH4428> and if<WH518> your servant<WH5650> have found favor<WH3190> in your sight,<WH6440> that you would send<WH7971> me to Judah,<WH3063> to the city<WH5892> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchers,<WH6913> that I may build<WH1129> it.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to me, (the queen<WH7694> also sitting<WH3427> by him,) For how<WH5704> long<WH5704> shall your journey<WH4109> be? and when<WH4970> will you return?<WH7725> So it pleased<WH3190> the king<WH4428> to send<WH7971> me; and I set<WH5414> him a time.<WH2165>

Moreover I said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> If it please<WH2895> the king,<WH4428> let letters<WH107> be given<WH5414> me to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river,<WH5104> that they may convey<WH5674> me over<WH5674> till<WH5704> I come<WH935> into<WH413> Judah;<WH3063>

And a letter<WH107> to Asaph<WH623> the keeper<WH8104> of the king's<WH4428> forest,<WH6508> that he may give<WH5414> me timber<WH6086> to make beams<WH7136> for the gates<WH8179> of the palace<WH1002> which<WH834> appertained to the house,<WH1004> and for the wall<WH2346> of the city,<WH5892> and for the house<WH1004> that I shall enter<WH935> into.<WH5921> And the king<WH4428> granted<WH5414> me, according to the good<WH2896> hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> on me.

Then I came<WH935> to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river,<WH5104> and gave<WH5414> them the king's<WH4428> letters.<WH107> Now the king<WH4428> had sent<WH7971> captains<WH8269> of the army<WH2428> and horsemen<WH6571> with me.

When Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite,<WH2772> and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant,<WH5650> the Ammonite,<WH5984> heard<WH8085> of it, it grieved<WH7489> them exceedingly<WH1419> that there was come<WH935> a man<WH120> to seek<WH1245> the welfare<WH2896> of the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>
So I came<WH935> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> and was there<WH8033> three<WH7969> days.<WH3117>

And I arose<WH6965> in the night,<WH3915> I and some<WH4592> few<WH4592> men<WH582> with me; neither<WH3808> told<WH5046> I any man<WH120> what<WH4100> my God<WH430> had put<WH5414> in my heart<WH3820> to do<WH6213> at Jerusalem:<WH3389> neither<WH369> was there any beast<WH929> with me, save<WH3588> <WH518> the beast<WH929> that I rode<WH7392> on.

And I went<WH3318> out by night<WH3915> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley,<WH1516> even before<WH413> <WH6440> the dragon<WH8577> well,<WH5869> and to the dung<WH830> port,<WH8179> and viewed<WH7663> the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> which<WH834> were broken<WH6555> down, and the gates<WH8179> thereof were consumed<WH398> with fire.<WH784>

Then I went<WH5674> on<WH413> to the gate<WH8179> of the fountain,<WH5869> and to the king's<WH4428> pool:<WH1295> but there was no<WH369> place<WH4725> for the beast<WH929> that was under<WH8478> me to pass.<WH5674>

Then went<WH5927> I up in the night<WH3915> by the brook,<WH5158> and viewed<WH7663> the wall,<WH2346> and turned<WH7725> back,<WH7725> and entered<WH935> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley,<WH1516> and so returned.<WH7725>

And the rulers<WH5461> knew<WH3045> not where<WH575> I went,<WH1980> or what<WH4100> I did;<WH6213> neither<WH3808> had I as yet<WH5704> <WH3651> told<WH5046> it to the Jews,<WH3064> nor to the priests,<WH3548> nor to the nobles,<WH2715> nor to the rulers,<WH5461> nor to the rest<WH3499> that did<WH6213> the work.<WH4399>

Then said<WH559> I to them, You see<WH7200> the distress<WH7451> that we are in, how<WH834> Jerusalem<WH3389> lies waste,<WH2720> and the gates<WH8179> thereof are burned<WH3341> with fire:<WH784> come,<WH3212> and let us build<WH1129> up the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that we be no<WH3808> more<WH5750> a reproach.<WH2781>

Then I told<WH5046> them of the hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> which<WH834> was good<WH2896> on me; as also<WH637> the king's<WH4428> words<WH1697> that he had spoken<WH559> to me. And they said,<WH559> Let us rise<WH6965> up and build.<WH1129> So they strengthened<WH2388> their hands<WH3027> for this good<WH2896> work.

But when Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite,<WH2772> and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant,<WH5650> the Ammonite,<WH5984> and Geshem<WH1654> the Arabian,<WH6163> heard<WH8085> it, they laughed<WH3932> us to scorn, and despised<WH959> us, and said,<WH559> What<WH4100> is this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> that you do?<WH6213> will you rebel<WH4775> against<WH5921> the king?<WH4428>

Then answered<WH7725> <WH1697> I them, and said<WH559> to them, The God<WH430> of heaven,<WH8064> he will prosper<WH6743> us; therefore we his servants<WH5650> will arise<WH6965> and build:<WH1129> but you have no<WH369> portion,<WH2506> nor right,<WH6666> nor memorial,<WH2146> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>
